corpus.title: Existence of Modular Inverse
corpus.description: Modular inverse of a mod n exists iff gcd(a, n) = 1

corpus.title: Integer Division Theorem
corpus.description: Let a and b be integers, with b > 0. Then there exist unique integers q and r such that a = b*q + r and 0 ≤ r < b.

corpus.title: Euler's Totient Function
corpus.description: Euler's totient function ϕ(n) is the number of numbers smaller than n and coprime to it.

corpus.title: Euclid's lemma
corpus.description: If a prime divides the product of two numbers, it must divide at least one of those numbers.

corpus.title: Coprime
corpus.description: Two numbers are coprime iff 1 is the only positive number which divides both of them.

corpus.title: Euler's Theorem
corpus.description: If a and n are coprime, then a^phi(n) ≡ 1 (mod n), where phi is Euler's Totient Function.

corpus.title: ab is coprime to x iff a and b are coprime to x
If x divides ab and x is coprime to a, then x divides b
corpus.description: If a number divides the product of two numbers and is coprime to the first number in the product, then it must divide the second number in the product.

corpus.title: Multiplication permutes Zn*
corpus.description: Multiplying all elements of Zn* by a number coprime to n returns a permutation of Zn*

corpus.title: GCD times LCM equals product
corpus.description: gcd(a, b) * lcm(a, b) = a * b

corpus.title: Modular addition
corpus.description: a1 ≡ b1 and a2 ≡ b2 implies a1+a2 ≡ b1+b2

corpus.title: Modular Equivalence
corpus.description: a is equivalent to b mod n iff n divides (a-b).

corpus.title: Modular multiplication
corpus.description: a1 ≡ b1 and a2 ≡ b2 implies a1a2 ≡ b1b2

corpus.title: Divisible iff PFEL is less than or equal
corpus.description: a divides b iff PFEL(a) ≤ PFEL(b).

corpus.title: Every number has a prime factorization
PFEL of product is sum of PFEL
Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
corpus.description: An integer can be written as a product of primes in a unique way.

corpus.title: PFEL of gcd is min of PFEL
Prime Factorization Exponent List (PFEL)
corpus.description: PFEL of a number is the list of exponents in the prime factorization of that number.

corpus.title: PFEL of lcm is max of PFEL
PFEL of ratio is difference of PFEL
GCD is the smallest Linear Combination
corpus.description: The gcd of a set of numbers is their smallest positive linear combination.

corpus.title: Common divisor divides GCD
corpus.description: Commmon divisor of a set of numbers divides their GCD.

corpus.title: gcd(a1/d, a2/d, ..., an/d) = gcd(a1, a_2, ..., an)/d
Semiring
corpus.description: A semiring is an algebraic structure similar to a ring, but without the requirement that each element must have an additive inverse.

corpus.title: Inverse of a group element is unique
corpus.description: Inverse of a group element is unique.

corpus.title: Third isomorphism theorem
corpus.description: (G/N)/(K/N) is isomorphic to G/K.

corpus.title: Condition for a subset to be a subgroup
corpus.description: Condition for a subset to be a subgroup.

corpus.title: External direct product is a group
corpus.description: For groups G and H, G × H is a group

corpus.title: Conditions for a subset to be a subgroup
corpus.description: Conditions for a subset to be a subgroup.

corpus.title: Second isomorphism theorem
corpus.description: Let S be a subgroup of G and N be a normal subgroup of G. Then SN/N is isomorphic to S/(S∩N).

corpus.title: Zn* is a group
corpus.description: The set of integers coprime to n is a group under multiplication mod n

corpus.title: Order of element divides order of group
First isomorphism theorem
corpus.description: Image of homomorphism ϕ from G to H is isomorphic to quotient group G/ker(ϕ).

corpus.title: Identity of a group is unique
corpus.description: Identity of a group is unique.

corpus.title: Order of element in external direct product
corpus.description: order of (g, h) in G × H = lcm(order(g), order(h))

corpus.title: Group
corpus.description: A group is a set along with a binary operator which satisfies certain properties.

corpus.title: Group element to the power group size equals identity
corpus.description: a^|G| = e

corpus.title: Inverse of product of two elements of a group
Isomorphism on Groups
corpus.description: Two groups are isomorphic iff they are related via a bijection ϕ such that ϕ(ab) = ϕ(a)ϕ(b).

corpus.title: Order of elements is invariant under isomorphism
corpus.description: If G is isomorphic to H, then G and H have the same frequencies of orders of elements.

corpus.title: Cyclicness is invariant under isomorphism
corpus.description: If < a > is isomorphic to G via ϕ, then G = < ϕ(a) >.

corpus.title: Cayley's Theorem
corpus.description: Every group is isomorphic to a permutation group

corpus.title: Isomorphism of groups is an equivalence relation
Abelianness is invariant under isomorphism
corpus.description: If G is isomorphic to H and G is abelian, then H is abelian.

corpus.title: Inverse of a group isomorphism is a group isomorphism
Zm × Zn is isomorphic to Zmn iff m and n are coprime
Parity of a permutation
corpus.description: If a permutation can be written as a product of only an odd number of transpositions, it is called an odd permutation. If a permutation can be written as a product of only an even number of transpositions, it is called an even permutation. Every permutation is either an odd permutation or an even permutation.

corpus.title: Canonical cycle notation of a permutation
corpus.description: Canonical cycle notation is a unique way of writing a permutation as a product of disjoint cycles.

corpus.title: Product of disjoint cycles is commutative
Alternating Group
corpus.description: The set of all even permutations is called the alternating group

corpus.title: Permutation is transposition product
corpus.description: Every finite permutation can be written as a product of transpositions.

corpus.title: Permutation group
corpus.description: A permutation group on a finite set X is a group of bijections on X, where the group operator is function composition.

corpus.title: Transposition bijects even and odd permutations
corpus.description: There is a bijection between even and odd permutations. The bijective function multiplies a permutation by a transposition.

corpus.title: Permutation is disjoint cycle product
corpus.description: Every permutation can be written as the product of a unique set of disjoint cycles.

corpus.title: Product of cycles and a transposition
Correspondence theorem
corpus.description: A subgroup of G/N is of the form K/N, where K is a subgroup of G. If K is a subgroup of G, then K/N is a subgroup of G/N.

corpus.title: Factor group
corpus.description: The group of all cosets of a normal subgroup is called the factor group or quotient group.

corpus.title: Normal correspondence theorem
corpus.description: A normal subgroup of G/N is of the form K/N, where K is a normal subgroup of G. If K is a normal subgroup of G, then K/N is a normal subgroup of G/N.

corpus.title: Subgroups of a cyclic group
corpus.description: For an infinite-order cyclic group <a>, subgroups are <a^k> for all k. For a cyclic group <a> of order n, subgroups are <a^k> for all divisors k of n.

corpus.title: Group of prime order is cyclic
Order of elements in cyclic group
corpus.description: Order of elements in a cyclic group.

corpus.title: A cyclic group of order n has ϕ(n) generators
Cyclic groups are isomorphic to Z or Zn
corpus.description: A cyclic group of infinite order is isomorphic to Z. A cyclic group of order n is isomorphic to Zn.

corpus.title: Mapping of power is power of mapping
corpus.description: ϕ(g^k) = ϕ(g)^k

corpus.title: Homomorphic mapping of subgroup of domain is subgroup of codomain
corpus.description: Homomorphic mapping of subgroup of domain is subgroup of codomain. Inverse mapping of subgroup of codomain is subgroup of domain.

corpus.title: Homomorphic mapping and inverse mapping of normal subgroup is normal
corpus.description: Homomorphic mapping of normal subgroup is normal in homomorphic mapping of group. Homomorphic inverse mapping of normal subgroup of codomain is normal in domain.

corpus.title: Homomorphism on groups
corpus.description: A homomorphism ϕ is a function from one group to another such that ϕ(ab) = ϕ(a)ϕ(b).

corpus.title: Ideal
corpus.description: An ideal I is a subring of R with the absorption property, i.e. aI = I for all a in R.

corpus.title: 0x = 0 = x0
corpus.description: Let R be a ring. For all elements x in R, 0x = 0 = x0.

corpus.title: I is a prime ideal iff R/I is an integral domain
corpus.description: Let I be an ideal of R, a commutative ring with unity. Then I is prime in R iff R/I is an integral domain.

corpus.title: Field
corpus.description: (R, +, *) is a field iff (R, +) and (R, *) are abelian groups and the distributive property holds.

corpus.title: Zn is a ring
corpus.description: The set of integers modulo n is a ring.

corpus.title: I is a maximal ideal iff R/I is a field
corpus.description: Let I be an ideal of R, a commutative ring with unity. Then I is maximal in R iff R/I is a field.

corpus.title: Conditions for a subset of a ring to be a subring
Zp is an integral domain
corpus.description: If p is prime, Zp is an integral domain

corpus.title: Zp is a field
corpus.description: If p is prime, Zp is a field

corpus.title: Ring
corpus.description: A ring is a set with 2 operations (addition and multiplication) which satisfies certain properties.

corpus.title: Quotient Ring
corpus.description: Let I be an ideal of R. The quotient ring R/I is the set of all additive cosets of I.

corpus.title: Characteristic of ring equals additive order of unity
Integral Domain
corpus.description: R is an integral domain iff R is a commutative ring with unity and R has no zero-divisors.

corpus.title: Principal ideal
corpus.description: A principal ideal is a multiplicative coset

corpus.title: Every ideal of Z is a principal ideal
A field is an integral domain
A finite integral domain is a field
Being a field is preserved under isomorphism
Ring isomorphism
corpus.description: A ring isomorphism is a bijective function ϕ such that ϕ(a+b) = ϕ(a) + ϕ(b) and ϕ(ab) = ϕ(a)ϕ(b).

corpus.title: For subset H of a group, a(bH) = (ab)H and (aH)b = a(Hb)
corpus.description: Multiplication of a coset by a group element is associative. For subset H of a group, a(bH) = (ab)H and (aH)b = a(Hb).

corpus.title: Coset
corpus.metadata: A coset is a set obtained by multiplying every element of a subgroup by a group element.

corpus.title: Two cosets are either identical or disjoint
corpus.description: Two cosets are either identical or disjoint.

corpus.title: gH = H iff g in H
corpus.description: Coset of a subgroup equals the subgroup iff the representative is in the subgroup.

corpus.title: Lagrange's Theorem
corpus.description: Order of subgroup divides order of group. Furthermore, number of cosets equals ratio of orders of group and subgroup.

corpus.title: Product of ideal cosets is well-defined
corpus.description: Let I be an ideal. The product of cosets (a+I)(b+I) = ab+I is well-defined.

corpus.title: Product of normal cosets is well-defined
corpus.description: Let N be a normal subgroup. Then the product (aN)(bN) = (ab)N is well-defined.

corpus.title: Size of coset equals size of subset
corpus.description: Size of a coset of a subset equals the size of the subset

corpus.title: p-norm
corpus.description: The p-norm is a function which maps a vector to a number

corpus.title: Dot-product of vectors
corpus.metadata: The dot product of vectors u and v is the sum of product of corresponding elements in u and v.

corpus.title: Vector
corpus.description: A vector is a sequence of numbers with an element-wise addition operation and a scalar multiplication operation.

corpus.title: Kernel of linear transformation is subspace of domain
Canonical decomposition of a linear transformation
corpus.description: Let T be a linear transformation from U to V. Then T = T3.T2.T1 where T1: U to F^dim(U), T2: F^dim(U) to F^dim(V), T3: F^dim(V) to V are linear transformations. This is called the canonical decomposition of T.

corpus.title: Vector space isomorphism is an equivalence relation
Linear transformation
corpus.description: A linear transformation is a linear function mapping one vector space to another.

corpus.title: Vector spaces are isomorphic iff their dimensions are same
corpus.description: Two vector spaces are isomorphic iff they have the same dimension.

corpus.title: Basis of range of linear transformation
corpus.description: If P is a basis of the kernel and P union Q is a basis of U, then T(Q) is a basis of T(U).

corpus.title: Matrix of linear transformation
corpus.description: Every linear transformation from F^m to F^n can be expressed as a matrix pre-multiplication.

corpus.title: Composition of linear transformations
corpus.description: Composition of linear transformations is a linear transformation.

corpus.title: Range of linear transformation is subspace of codomain
Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
corpus.description: Let T be a linear transformation. If T(x) = kx is satisfied for some k and some x, then k is an eigenvalue and x is an eigenvector.

corpus.title: Diagonalization
corpus.description: Let A be a square matrix. Let P be the matrix whose columns are eigenvectors of A. Then AP = PD, where D is a diagonal matrix.

corpus.title: Eigenspace
corpus.description: Let A be a matrix and λ be an eigenvalue of A. Then E(λ) is the vector space of all solutions to Ax = λx.

corpus.title: Characteristic polynomial of a matrix
corpus.description: The characteristic polynomial of a matrix A is |xI - A|. Its roots are the eigenvalues of A.

corpus.title: A is diagonalizable iff there are n linearly independent eigenvectors
corpus.description: Let A be an n by n matrix. Then A is diagonalizable iff A has n linearly independent eigenvectors.

corpus.title: Inner product space
corpus.description: An inner product space is a vector space equipped with an inner product operator, which is an abstract generalization of the dot product.

corpus.title: x and y are parallel iff ∥x∥²∥y∥² = |< x, y >|².
corpus.description: Two vectors are parallel iff the absolute value of their dot product equals the product of their norms.

corpus.title: Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality
corpus.description: < u, v >² ≤ < u, u > < v, v >

corpus.title: A set of mutually orthogonal vectors is linearly independent
Norm
corpus.description: norm(x) = sqrt(< x, x >)

corpus.title: Inner product is anti-linear in second argument
corpus.description: < u, av > = conj(a) < u, v > and < u, v1+v2 > = < u, v1 > + < u, v2 >

corpus.title: Incrementing a linearly independent set
corpus.description: If S is linearly independent and v is not a linear combination of S, then S+{v} is linearly independent.

corpus.title: Vector Space
corpus.description: A vector space is a set of vectors along with a scalar multiplication operation.

corpus.title: Span
corpus.description: The span of a set of vectors is the set of all linear combinations of those vectors.

corpus.title: Linearly independent set is smaller than a span
corpus.description: The size of every finite linearly independent subset of a vector space is less than or equal to the size of every spanning set of that vector space.

corpus.title: Condition for being a subspace
corpus.description: Let W be a subset of vector space V. Then W is a subspace of V iff W is closed under addition and scalar multiplication.

corpus.title: Linear independence
corpus.description: A set of vectors are linearly independent iff no linear combination of them with some positive coefficients is 0.

corpus.title: Decrementing a span
corpus.description: If S has a linearly dependent element v, then span(S-{v}) = span(S).

corpus.title: Linearly independent set can be expanded into a basis
corpus.description: If a set of vectors is linearly independent, a finite number of vectors can be added to it to make it a basis if the vector space has a finite-sized basis.

corpus.title: Maximally linearly independent iff basis
corpus.description: A set is maximally linearly independent iff it is a basis.

corpus.title: Unique linear combination of basis
corpus.description: Let B be a finite basis of vector space V. Then every vector in V can be expressed uniquely as a linear combination of vectors in B.

corpus.title: Basis of a vector space
corpus.description: If a set of vectors S is linearly independent and spans a vector space V, then S is a basis of V.

corpus.title: Minimally spanning iff basis
corpus.description: A set of vectors S minimally spans V iff S is a basis.

corpus.title: All bases of a vector space have the same size
Spanning set of size dim(V) is a basis
A set of dim(V) linearly independent vectors is a basis
Matrices form an inner-product space
corpus.description: Let F be a subfield of complex numbers. Matrices over F form an inner-product space, where the inner product is given by tr(A*B).

corpus.title: Elementary row operation
corpus.description: An elementary row operation on a matrix either adds a multiple of a row to another row, multiplies a row by a scalar or swaps two rows.

corpus.title: Matrices over a field form a vector space
Trace of a matrix
corpus.description: The trace of a square matrix is the sum of its diagonal entries.

corpus.title: Full-rank square matrix in RREF is the identity matrix
corpus.description: Let A be an n by n matrix. If A is in RREF and all rows of A are non-zero, then A is the identity matrix.

corpus.title: Submatrix
corpus.description: A submatrix of a matrix M is a matrix obtained by removing a few rows and/or columns of M.

corpus.title: RREF([A|I]) = [I|inv(A)] iff A is invertible
corpus.description: This is an algorithm for finding the inverse of a matrix by calculating RREF.

corpus.title: Full-rank square matrix is invertible
corpus.description: Let A be an n by n matrix. Then rank(A) = n iff A has an inverse.

corpus.title: RREF is unique
corpus.description: Every matrix is row equivalent to a unique matrix in RREF.

corpus.title: Transpose of product
corpus.description: (AB)' = B'A'

corpus.title: Row space
corpus.description: The row space of a matrix is the set of all linear combinations of the rows of the matrix.

corpus.title: Matrix multiplication distributes over addition
corpus.description: A(B+C) = AB + AC.

corpus.title: Row equivalence of matrices
corpus.description: Matrices A and B are row equivalent iff B can be obtained from A by applying a finite number of elementary row operations to A.

corpus.title: A matrix is full-rank iff its rows are linearly independent
Row equivalence matrix
corpus.description: If A and B are row equivalent, then there exists an invertible matrix R such that B = RA.

corpus.title: Rows of RREF are linearly independent
corpus.description: If a matrix is in RREF, its non-zero rows are linearly independent.

corpus.title: Identity matrix
corpus.description: The identity matrix is a matrix I such that AI = IA = A.

corpus.title: Matrix
corpus.description: A matrix is set of numbers arranged in rows and columns.

corpus.title: Inverse of a matrix
corpus.description: The inverse of matrix A is a matrix B such that AB = BA = I.

corpus.title: Rank of a matrix
corpus.description: The rank of a matrix is the number of non-zero rows in the RREF of the matrix.

corpus.title: Row equivalent matrices have the same row space
Elementary row operation is matrix pre-multiplication
corpus.description: Every elementary row operation has a corresponding invertible matrix R such that the result of applying the operation on a matrix A is RA.

corpus.title: Inverse of product
corpus.description: inv(AB) = inv(B)inv(A)

corpus.title: Every elementary row operation has a unique inverse
Elementary row operation on stacked matrix
corpus.description: Let f be an elementary row operation. Then f([A|B]) = [f(A)|f(B)].

corpus.title: Stacking
corpus.description: [A|B] is the horizontal stacking of matrices. [A/B] is the vertical stacking of matrices.

corpus.title: Determinant after elementary row operation
corpus.description: Applying an elementary row operation on a matrix multiplies its determinant by a number which depends only on the type of the operation, not on the matrix.

corpus.title: Swapping last 2 rows of a matrix negates its determinant
Determinant
corpus.description: A determinant is a number associated with a square matrix.

corpus.title: Determinant of scalar product of matrix
corpus.description: |cA| = c^n|A|

corpus.title: A matrix is full-rank iff its determinant is non-0
Determinant of product is product of determinants
Determinant of upper triangular matrix
corpus.description: The determinant of an upper triangular matrix is the product of diagonal elements.

corpus.title: System of linear equations
corpus.description: A system of linear equations is a set of equations which equate linear combinations of variables to a value.

corpus.title: Equations with row equivalent matrices have the same solution set
corpus.description: If [A|B] is row equivalent to [C|D], then AX=B and CX=D have the same solution set.

corpus.title: Rank of a homogenous system of linear equations
corpus.description: If AX = 0 is a system of equations, then rank(A) = n iff X=0 is the only solution.

corpus.title: Homogeneous linear equations with more variables than unknowns
corpus.description: If AX = 0 is a system of linear equations with more variables than unknowns, then there exists a non-trivial solution.

corpus.title: q(x)F[x] is in p(x)F[x] iff p(x) divides q(x)
Factor theorem
corpus.description: (x-a) is a factor of p(x) iff p(a) = 0

corpus.title: Degree of factor is less than degree of polynomial
corpus.description: If a(x) divides p(x), degree of a(x) lies between 0 and deg(p).

corpus.title: Eisenstein's criterion
corpus.description: If f(x) is in Z[x] and p is prime and deg(f) = n and p divides all fi except fn and p^2 does not divide f0, then f is irreducible over Q[x].

corpus.title: R is commutative iff R[x] is commutative
Zero divisors of a polynomial
corpus.description: Ring R has no zero divisors iff the ring of polynomials R[x] has no zero divisors

corpus.title: Polynomial GCD theorem
corpus.description: The GCD of polynomials is unique and equals their least degree monic linear combination.

corpus.title: Degree of sum of polynomials
corpus.description: The degree of sum of 2 polynomials is at most the maximum of the degrees of those polynomials.

corpus.title: Polynomial divisibility
corpus.description: A polynomial p(x) is divisible in F[x] by q(x) iff there exists a polynomial r(x) such that p(x), q(x), r(x) are in F[x] and p(x) = q(x)r(x).

corpus.title: Degree of product of polynomials
corpus.description: deg(pq) ≤ deg(p) + deg(q). If coefficients of p and q are from an integral domain, deg(pq) = deg(p) + deg(q).

corpus.title: Irreducible polynomial
corpus.description: A polynomial is irreducible iff it cannot be expressed as a product of polynomials of lower degree.

corpus.title: A polynomial in rationals is a rational times a polynomial in integers
The ideal generated by an irreducible polynomial is maximal
Polynomial division theorem
corpus.description: If a and b are polynomials, a can be uniquely expressed as bq + r where deg(r) < deg(b).

corpus.title: F[x]/p(x): A ring
corpus.description: F[x]/p(x) is the ring of all polynomials modulo p(x).

corpus.title: GCD of polynomials
corpus.description: The GCD of a set of polynomials over a ring with unity is a largest degree monic polynomial which divides all polynomials in that set. Since 1 divides all polynomials, every set of polynomials has a GCD.

corpus.title: Every ideal in F[x] is principal
corpus.description: Every ideal the ring of polynomials of a field is a principal ideal

corpus.title: The ring F[x]/p(x) is a field iff p is irreducible
p(x)F[x] = F[x] iff p is a non-zero constant
Polynomials of a ring form a ring
corpus.description: The set of all polynomials is a ring if the coefficients are from a ring.

corpus.title: Gauss' Lemma
corpus.description: If a polynomial in Z[x] has a factor in Q[x], it also has a factor in Z[x] of the same degree.
